content.en: Disaster prediction: Researchers have been exploring the use of various algorithms to improve the mapping and prediction of natural disasters such as landslides and floods. For example, the Kalman filter algorithm is used to find optimal solutions in spatial multi-criteria evaluation. The Mamdani fuzzy algorithm is employed in a program called MamLand for landslide susceptibility mapping. Other algorithms like Adaptive Neuro Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) and Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) are combined to improve the accuracy of landslide prediction models. These studies highlight the potential of algorithms to enhance our understanding and management of natural hazards.
content.da: Naturkatastrofe forudsigelse: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af forskellige algoritmer for at forbedre kortlægning og forudsigelse af naturkatastrofer såsom jordskred og oversvømmelser. For eksempel bruges Kalman-filter algoritmen til at finde optimale løsninger i rumlig multi-kriterie evaluering. Mamdani fuzzy algoritmen anvendes i et program kaldet MamLand til kortlægning af jordskreds sårbarhed. Andre algoritmer som Adaptive Neuro Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) og Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) kombineres for at forbedre nøjagtigheden af jordskreds forudsigelsesmodeller. Disse undersøgelser understreger potentialet for algoritmer til at forbedre vores forståelse og håndtering af naturfarer.
